p: Cyclooxygenase (COX-1 or COX-2) inhibitors, classified as NSAIDs-nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs, are considered to be the most common medications for inflammatory diseases due to their effectiveness in the treatment of fever, redness, pain, and edema. Most of the used NSAIDs are associated with harmful side effects, including gastrointestinal ulcers, renal failure, and hepatic dysfunction [ 5, 6].
